abstract: Two new papers help explain why nearly all new companies with headquarters in the United states choose to incorporate and pay tax here.
snippet: Two new papers help explain why nearly all new companies with headquarters in the United states choose to incorporate and pay tax here.
lead_paragraph: The tactics that multinational companies like Apple, Microsoft and Hewlett-Packard use to avoid paying corporate income taxes might make one wonder why they incorporate in the United States in the first place. Why not Ireland?

headline.main: Despite Tax Rules, Companies Stick With U.S.
